729330f-b.title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Forest Avenue
729330f-b.text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and
Snoe Street, showing the barn on the David C. Decker property.
Mr. P.L. Sperr states tkat the windows are from a church that
once stood in Hillside Cemetery.
January 4, 1924.
By Wm. T. Davis through P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the rear of the barn. It stands 150 feet back
of the avenue.
January 4, 1924.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
729330f-b.folder: Richmond Avenue & Forest Avenue, Staten Island, NY

728844f-a.title: Richmond: Forest Avenue - Richmond Avenue
728844f-a.text:
Forest Avenue, near Richmond Avenue, showing two old railroad
cars that have been converted into a residence.
May 1927.
P.L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
728844f-a.folder: Forest Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

728845f-a.title: Richmond: Forest Avenue - Richmond Avenue
728845f-a.folder: Forest Avenue & Richmond Avenue, Staten Island, NY

729329f-a.title: Richmond: Richmond Avenue - Forest Avenue
729329f-a.text:
Richmond Avenue, east side, between Forest Avenue and
Wonsey Place. Mr. Sperr refers to this house as the D. C. Decker
House. On Beers's 1874 map it appears as the J. Simonson house.
January 4, 1924
By Wm. T. Davis through P. L. Sperr
NO REPRODUCTIONS
729329f-a.folder: Richmond Avenue & Forest Avenue, Staten Island, NY
